title: Official Blind Review #2
review_assessment:_checking_correctness_: I did not assess the derivations or theory.
review:
This paper analyzes the invariance properties of the K-FAC algorithm by reconstructing the algorithm in a coordinate-free way where the neural network is viewed as a series of affine mappings alternating with nonlinear activation functions. It converts the original metric into an approximate metric, whose coordinate representation matches the K-FAC approximation. So K-FAC can be viewed as the exact natural gradient under the new metric rather than an approximation under the Fisher metric.

Why is the invariance important? How does the proposed framework help us develop better algorithms? Without empirical studies, it is not easy to see the significance of this work.
